data.text:
Inspired beyond 9-5

Hallam-ICS is built on meaningful camaraderie, professional relationships that push us to deepen our technical expertise, and impactful service in the communities where we live. Each project, personally and professionally, inspires the next. These motivators are why we work. Why we stay. Why we grow. At Hallam-ICS, we’re proud to hire and care for the best and brightest engineers, so we can offer motivated teams to clients that inspire measurable results for clients.

Flexible and respectful work environment

We recognize that our employees live active and productive lives that don’t stop when they enter our doors each work day. We want you to attend your child’s concert or sporting event, take that dream vacation and we know you may need to go to the doctor’s or wait for that repairman. You can do that when you work at Hallam-ICS because we don’t micromanage! We hire grownups who we are confident will approach their work responsibly; honoring their commitments to excellent work, our clients and each other. Our employees come to work engaged and supported because they are given the flexibility to manage their busy work and personal lives and provided the tools to make that possible.

To have an amazing career at Hallam-ICS you'll need the fundamental skills, respect for your colleagues and clients, passion for your work, attention to details and quality – and love for what you can do to help others.

What can you get from joining our team?

Great professionals are deeply invested in their field and truly committed to a long-term career. After all, it took several years of challenging education to get where they are and many more to learn the multi-disciplinary technologies. It would make sense to work for a company that indeed appreciates the effort.

Become an ESOP member, at Hallam-ICS every employee is an owner.

Work with engineers, architects, scientists, environmental, health, safety and industrial people.

Travel - work with clients locally, regionally, throughout the USA and internationally. Unique opportunities have occurred, which included trips to Canada, South America, Europe, Africa, and as far away as Singapore.

Develop relationships with vendors specializing in high technology solutions for complex challenges.

Our Commitment

We are committed to meeting our customers' needs while maintaining a relaxed, small office environment with business casual attire and flex-time. Our commitment to our employees includes competitive compensation, benefits packages, professional development and assistance with continuing education. Hallam-ICS is an equal opportunity employer – M/F/V/H.

Open Positions:

Vermont - New York - Connecticut

REVIT/CAD SPECIALIST - Multiple locations

[Email this job link]

Overall Activities: We currently have an opening for a Revit/CAD Specialist in one of our offices. If you are a positive, flexible, team player who enjoys variety and helping others, we have a great opportunity we’d like to talk to you about.

In this position, you will work with our project teams to generate and/or manage project Revit MEP models and AutoCAD MEP files. You’ll manage project file updates, troubleshooting, and drafting when necessary.

Qualifications:

Friendly, flexible, and organized with an upbeat “can-do” attitude and a collaborative approach to problem-solving.

This role requires an individual who possesses strong communication skills, both verbal and written, is highly organized, and has the willingness and ability to adjust to constantly changing priorities.

Solid REVIT and AutoCAD experience and a willingness to learn more

Knowledge of basic drafting techniques

Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Ability to work well with many different types of individuals – in person and remote

Vermont

New York

ENTRY LEVEL ELECTRICAL ENGINEER – Malta, NY

[Email this job link]

Overall Activities: We currently have an opening for an Entry Level Electrical Engineer in our Malta, NY office. In this GROWTH position, you will work with experienced engineers on multi-discipline engineering projects for a wide range of facilities in the region. The successful candidate will have an interest in working in multi-disciplinary project teams, coordinating with sub-consultants, successfully engaging with, and satisfying clients, and be excited by the opportunity to expand and grow in our business. Familiarity with current good engineering design practices, the National Electric Code and NFPA 70E for building electrical systems is preferred.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering

Excellent communication skills

A self-starter with self-management, technical, and interpersonal skills, and the desire to work in a small, self-directed team environment.

An EIT or scheduled to sit for the exam.

Proficiency in AutoCAD and other software design tools.

Familiarity with current good engineering design practices, the National Electric

Compensation Range:

$68,000 - $78,000

Connecticut

Massachusetts

SITE SUPERINTENDENT – Mansfield, MA

[Email this job link]

Overall Activities: We currently have an opening for a Site Superintendent in our Mansfield, MA office. Working onsite directly with clients and our project teams, you will manage day to day subcontractor activities, coordinate with other trades and the owner on large, turn-key control system or instrumentation projects, helping the Project Manager to lead them from concept to completion on time, on budget, and with high quality and client satisfaction.

Qualifications:

2-5 years of experience in a similar role.

Bachelor’s degree in construction management or engineering, or equivalent experience.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Basic electrical knowledge.

Experience working with industrial automation, instrumentation and industrial or commercial construction, a plus.

Cleanroom construction in a life sciences or advanced technology facility is a plus.

Knowledge of project budgets and schedule preferred.

SENIOR CONTROLS ENGINEER – Mansfield, MA

[Email this job link]

Overall Activities: We currently have an opening for a Senior Controls Engineer in our Mansfield, MA office. This position will cover the North End of Boston/Southern NH and involves the design, programming and configuration of controls systems including PLC, HMI, SCADA and other components to ensure proper system operation.

Qualifications and Experience:

8+ years of controls engineering experience working with PLC,HMI and SCADA systems.

Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering, Technology or Computer Science preferred.

Proficiency with PLC ladder logic and operator interface and SCADA development packages. Rockwell PLCs, FTView SE/ME, iFix and Ignition preferred.

Proficiency with Windows-based operating systems, word processing and spreadsheets.

Ability to read and interpret P&ID and electrical controls drawings.

Experience in conducting Factory Acceptance Testing and documentation.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Excellent attention to detail.

Must be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and in a team environment.

Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize and juggle multiple tasks

Flexibility and the ability to work in variable conditions

Interested in continually learning and developing new skills

Training or Experience with the following is a plus:

Experience with Visual Basic or SQL programming languages.

Knowledge of computer networking and configuration.

Experience with the installation of control panels and instrumentation.

GAMP® validation and commissioning.

SENIOR MECHANICAL ENGINEER, PE - Mansfield, MA

[Email this job link]

Overall Activities: Working from our Mansfield, MA office, the candidate will lead multi-discipline engineering projects for biotechnology, pharmaceutical, higher education and research facilities in Southern New England. The candidate should have experience with designing complex HVAC and Mechanical systems for a wide range of facilities.

Qualifications:

BSME and 5 years of experience in HVAC and Mechanical system design.

A Professional Engineering license is required.

LEED-AP preferred.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are required.

Proficiency in AutoCAD/Revit and other software design tools, as well as familiarity with current good engineering design practices is preferred.
